com.noctarius.tengi.spi.buffer

Interface WritableMemoryBuffer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MemoryBuffer

    public interface WritableMemoryBuffer
    The WritableMemoryBuffer interface describes a buffer which contains a content-stream to be written to. Only basic data types can be written to this buffer directly. For more complex types, additional helpers need to be used to write multi-byte types or values to the stream.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • writable

        boolean writable()

        Returns true if the buffer is writable, otherwise false. Returning true means that the current writerIndex() ()} value is smaller than the internal maximal capacity.

        If this method returns true, than the returned value of writableBytes() ()} must be greater than 0.

        Returns:
        returns true if more bytes are available to write, otherwise false

      • writableBytes

        int writableBytes()

        Returns the number of upcoming bytes to write. This value represents the number of bytes between the current writerIndex() ()} and the maximum capacity of the content-stream.

        If this method returns a value greater than 0, than the returned value of writable() ()} must be true.

        Returns:
        returns the number of writable (upcoming) bytes

      • writeBytes

        void writeBytes(byte[] bytes)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is written as a whole from begin to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBytes

        void writeBytes(byte[] bytes,
                int offset,
                int length)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is written as a whole beginning from the given offset and as many bytes as defined by the given length will be transferred.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to be written to the buffer
        offset - the offset to begin to read from
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBuffer

        void writeBuffer(ByteBuffer byteBuffer)

        Transfers the content of a ByteBuffer to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The ByteBuffer is written as a whole from begin to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - the ByteBuffer to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBuffer

        void writeBuffer(ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                 int offset,
                 int length)

        Transfers the content of a ByteBuffer to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The ByteBuffer is written as a whole beginning from the given offset and as many bytes as defined by the given length will be transferred.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - the ByteBuffer to be written to the buffer
        offset - the offset to begin to read from
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBuffer

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • writeByte

        void writeByte(int value)

        Transfers the content of a byte to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the byte value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:

      • writerIndex

        int writerIndex()
        Returns the current write index position inside the buffer.
        Returns:
        the current write index position

      • writerIndex

        void writerIndex(int writerIndex)
        Sets the write index position inside the buffer to the given value.
        Parameters:
        writerIndex - the new write index position to be set
